bill_title: apply certain teaching experience toward student teaching requirements.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to apply certain teaching experience toward student teaching requirements. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-42 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person who has been employed as a full-time teacher at an accredited school in South Dakota on a temporary, emergency, or provisional basis for at least one continuous semester may receive student teaching credit for teacher certification purposes for such teaching experience. To receive student teaching credit, the person shall pay tuition to the institution that will grant the credit. In addition, the person shall provide documentation of satisfactory teaching performance and a recommendation from the superintendent of the school system in which the person was employed. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
